<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre><span class="pl-c"># Don't delete this chunk if you are using the mosaic package</span>
<span class="pl-c"># This loads the mosaic and dplyr packages</span>
require(<span class="pl-smi">mosaic</span>)
require(<span class="pl-smi">DCF</span>)</pre></div>

<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre><span class="pl-c"># Some customization.  You can alter or delete as desired (if you know what you are doing).</span>

<span class="pl-c"># This changes the default colors in lattice plots.</span>
trellis.par.set(<span class="pl-v">theme</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>theme.mosaic())  

<span class="pl-c"># knitr settings to control how R chunks work.</span>
require(<span class="pl-smi">knitr</span>)
<span class="pl-smi">opts_chunk</span><span class="pl-k">$</span>set(
  <span class="pl-v">tidy</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">FALSE</span>,     <span class="pl-c"># display code as typed</span>
  <span class="pl-v">size</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>small<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>    <span class="pl-c"># slightly smaller font for code</span>
)
<span class="pl-c"># This loads the mosaic data sets.  (Could be deleted if you are not using them.)</span>
require(<span class="pl-smi">mosaicData</span>)                </pre></div>

<h3><a id="user-content-introduction" class="anchor" href="#introduction" aria-hidden="true"><span class="octicon octicon-link"></span></a>Introduction</h3>

<p>Text mining (a form of text analytics) is a fast-growing application of statistical and machine learning techniques.  There are a number of R packages that facilitate
analysis of text documents.
The <code>aRxiv</code> package facilitates access to <a href="http://arXiv.org">http://arXiv.org</a>, a repository
of electronic preprints for a number of scientific disciplines.  It receives
many thousands of new submissions each month.
In this example, we utilize functions from the <code>tm</code> package to
generate a corpus of documents (a structured
set of texts) consisting of the abstracts from a search of papers on
<a href="http://arxiv.org">http://arxiv.org</a>.</p>

<p>In this markdown file, we will explore some 
analyses of the text in some of these abstracts.</p>

<p>To avoid overloading the arXiv server, we will use data that have been previously downloaded using the following commands:</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre>require(<span class="pl-smi">aRxiv</span>); require(<span class="pl-smi">lubridate</span>); require(<span class="pl-smi">stringr</span>)
<span class="pl-smi">papers</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> arxiv_search(<span class="pl-v">query</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>cat:stat*<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">limit</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">1000</span>)
<span class="pl-smi">papers</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> mutate(<span class="pl-smi">papers</span>, <span class="pl-v">submityear</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span>
  year(sapply(str_split(<span class="pl-smi">submitted</span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span> <span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>), <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>[[<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-c1">1</span>)))
save(<span class="pl-smi">papers</span>, <span class="pl-v">file</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>arXivpapers2015-05.Rda<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)</pre></div>

<p>Download the dataframe with the papers</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre><span class="pl-smi">filename</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>arXivpapers2015-05.Rda<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>
<span class="pl-k">if</span> (<span class="pl-k">!</span>file.exists(<span class="pl-smi">filename</span>)) {
  download.file(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>http://dtkaplan.github.io/USCOTS-2015/Handouts/arXivpapers2015-05.Rda<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-smi">filename</span>)
}
load(<span class="pl-smi">filename</span>)</pre></div>

<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre>names(<span class="pl-smi">papers</span>)
glimpse(<span class="pl-smi">papers</span>)
tally(<span class="pl-k">~</span> <span class="pl-smi">submityear</span>, <span class="pl-v">data</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">papers</span>)</pre></div>

<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre><span class="pl-c"># what has Brad Efron been up to?</span>
<span class="pl-smi">efron</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> filter(<span class="pl-smi">papers</span>, grepl(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Efron<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-smi">authors</span>))
<span class="pl-smi">efron</span></pre></div>

<pre lang="r,"><code># let's use the text mining package to create a corpus
require(tm)
mycorpus &lt;- VCorpus(DataframeSource(data.frame(papers$abstract)))
head(strwrap(mycorpus[[1]]))
</code></pre>

<p>Next we want to clean up the corpus.
The <code>tm_map()</code> function is called repeatedly to strip whitespace,
remove numbers and punctuation, map all of the text to lowercase, and
elide common English words.</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre><span class="pl-smi">origcorpus</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> <span class="pl-smi">mycorpus</span>
<span class="pl-smi">mycorpus</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> tm_map(<span class="pl-smi">mycorpus</span>, <span class="pl-smi">stripWhitespace</span>)
<span class="pl-smi">mycorpus</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> tm_map(<span class="pl-smi">mycorpus</span>, <span class="pl-smi">removeNumbers</span>)
<span class="pl-smi">mycorpus</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> tm_map(<span class="pl-smi">mycorpus</span>, <span class="pl-smi">removePunctuation</span>)
<span class="pl-smi">mycorpus</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> tm_map(<span class="pl-smi">mycorpus</span>, content_transformer(<span class="pl-smi">tolower</span>))
<span class="pl-smi">mycorpus</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> tm_map(<span class="pl-smi">mycorpus</span>, <span class="pl-smi">removeWords</span>, stopwords(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>english<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>))
head(strwrap(<span class="pl-smi">mycorpus</span>[[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>]]))</pre></div>

<p>Let's generate a wordcloud...</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre>require(<span class="pl-smi">wordcloud</span>)
wordcloud(<span class="pl-smi">mycorpus</span>, <span class="pl-v">colors</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>brewer.pal(<span class="pl-c1">6</span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Dark2<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>), <span class="pl-v">random.order</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">FALSE</span>)</pre></div>

<p>Finally, the <code>DocumentTermMatrix()</code> can be used to generate a document
term matrix.  This is a sparse matrix that describes the frequency of terms
in a corpus.  We can display the terms which arise in 100 or more of the abstracts.</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre><span class="pl-smi">dtm</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> DocumentTermMatrix(<span class="pl-smi">mycorpus</span>)
findFreqTerms(<span class="pl-smi">dtm</span>, <span class="pl-c1">100</span>)</pre></div>

<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre><span class="pl-c"># what words are associated with "markov"?</span>
findAssocs(<span class="pl-smi">dtm</span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>markov<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-c1">0.5</span>)</pre></div>

<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre><span class="pl-c"># what words are associated with "regression"?</span>
findAssocs(<span class="pl-smi">dtm</span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>regression<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-c1">0.4</span>)</pre></div>

<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre><span class="pl-smi">origcorpus</span>[[<span class="pl-c1">7</span>]]</pre></div>

<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre>inspect(DocumentTermMatrix(<span class="pl-smi">mycorpus</span>, <span class="pl-k">list</span>(<span class="pl-v">dictionary</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>c(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>bayesian<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>markov<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>bootstrap<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>))))</pre></div>
</article>
